meanings.definition: relating to or promoting the formation of bone
meanings.sent1: The osteogenic diet includes foods that help build strong bones.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise is osteogenic and contributes to bone health.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that his secret recipe was so osteogenic, it could make bones grow overnight!
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was like an osteogenic force, encouraging growth and strength.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the window felt osteogenic, as if it could strengthen bones just by touching them.

meanings.sent1: Stem cells have the remarkable ability to be osteogenic and form new bone tissue.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that certain vitamins are essential for maintaining osteogenic potential.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's invention was so osteogenic that it could create bone cells out of thin air!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as osteogenic as a bone marrow transplant, generating new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The potion in the fairy tale was said to be osteogenic, able to turn anything it touched into bone cells.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the development of bone tissue
meanings.sent1: During childhood, the body undergoes an osteogenic phase where bone tissue grows rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The specialist recommended specific exercises to support osteogenic processes in the body.
meanings.sent3: The movie character's superpower was being able to control the osteogenic growth of bones!
meanings.sent4: His words were like an osteogenic catalyst, sparking the growth of new ideas in the team.
meanings.sent5: The ancient potion was rumored to have osteogenic properties, able to heal even the most severe bone injuries.
